divs: sighting details i had just let the dog out in the back yard to do his bedtime business and also wanted to check the sky looking for the predicted cloud cover to move in,i had a fishing trip planned for (o dark 30)the next morning and needed to know weather to pack my rain outfit it looked to be clear,but i needed a better view because of the overhead awning. the steps on my back yard deck face west and i walked towards them to check on the dog and get a better look at the sky. that's when an object caught my eye in the western sky about 30 degrees above the horizon. at first i thought it was a low a\c or maybe a helicopter because of the flashing red,green,and brite white lights. being a retired united airlines lead a&p tech. i always try to judge if an a\c is coming towards me or going away by which side the red or green nav. lights are on (port or starboard)l\h being port,r\h starboard. in this case they seemed to the naked eye to be moving all over the place. i then went into the house and got my binoculars(10 x 50) and checked the object out again thru them,again they appeared to be all moving around,i needed a little more magnification to be able to make out what i was seeing so i went back in and got my 30x spotter scope with them i got a good look at what was going the red,green and white lights started moving into a vertical counter clock wise circle facing my direction around a very bright center white light, they were moving like a ferris wheel, then i knew it was no conventional a\c with nav. lights like that. they then went horizontal like the rings of the planet saturn then into a gyroscope configuration spinning and rotating. i watched the object for a good 20 min's. before it moved further of to the west and then it was gone.it did not appear to be more then 5 miles away, its hard to tell the altitude, about 30 degrees above the horizon, maybe 5000ft. i was not emotionally affected by seeing the object,more puzzled then anything. regards , thom flynn
